DataElement.preferredName: FACIT-D Questionnaire Version 4 D5 How True Past Seven Days Have Abdominal Cramps or Discomfort Due to Diarrhea Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how true in the past 7 days they have abdominal cramps or discomfort due to diarrhea (diarrhoea), using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Diarrhea How True Past Week Have Abdominal Cramps or Discomfort Due to Diarrhea Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A symptom-specific subscale of the FACIT scales that is used to assess how diarrhea affects an individual's life._A question about an individual's agreement with a statement._The most recent week, including today._A question about whether an individual has or had abdominal cramps or discomfort due to diarrhea._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Diarrhea
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A symptom-specific subscale of the FACIT scales that is used to assess how diarrhea affects an individual's life.

Concepts.longName: Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Diarrhea
Concepts.definition: A symptom-specific subscale of the FACIT scales that is used to assess how diarrhea affects an individual's life.

Property.preferredName: How True Past Week Have Abdominal Cramps or Discomfort Due to Diarrhea Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about an individual's agreement with a statement.:The most recent week, including today.:A question about whether an individual has or had abdominal cramps or discomfort due to diarrhea.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about an individual's agreement with a statement.
The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: Have Abdominal Cramps or Discomfort Due to Diarrhea
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual has or had abdominal cramps or discomfort due to diarrhea.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 0 (Not at all) to 4 (Very Much) on a Likert scale used on FACT questionnaires.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match NCIt. mc 9/8/20

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: I have abdominal cramps or di
ReferenceDocuments.description: I have abdominal cramps or discomfort due to my diarrhea (diarrhoea)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Link to Scoring and Interpretation Manual
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are accessible after registration on the FACIT website.
